page.title: 15PUBLIC SERVICES
page.content: Since the landscape is so hilly and the houses and farms are so widely separated, it is usual to find homes which have no mains{drainage,}no mains {water}supply, and no mains{gas}supply. Many homes are fitted with{ {wood-burning stoves,}use{spring water, and drain their sewage into{septic {tanks.} One house, the home of a computer lecturer, has a custom built system for providing hot water, and for operating the central heating. Three sources of{energy}are used. An open fire in the large lounge has a back boiler. An alternative is a wood-burning stove situated in the {cellar.}Should either of these not produce sufficient heat, then a{butane {gas}system is automatically triggered to take over or to supplement the system.
